SDL_Surface * mp_surface

Detailed Description

Surface class represents a 2 dimensional image.

The surface is a 2D image derived from GfxObj. It is also the basic unit of the engine, since most of the animations are based on superposition of surfaces. Planes currently are also implemented using surfaces.

See also:
GfxObj Plane

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Surface::Surface (  )

Default constructor.

Creates a null surface. This constructor is used by Screen() and should not be used anywhere else.

Surface::Surface ( uint  width,
uint  height 
)

Creates a surface with determined size.

This should be the preferred method for creating empty surfaces.

Parameters:
widthSurface width.
heightSurface height.
Surface::Surface ( const char *  file )

Creates a surface from a file.

Loads the image and its parameters from file. Uses IMG_Load library, so it currently supports BMP, PNG and TGA files. Note: per-pixel alpha (PPA) should be set in 'config.ini' in order to work with PNG and TGA images.

Parameters:
fileFile name as a c-string.
See also:
Config.h
Surface::Surface ( const Surface &  s )

Copy constructor.

Clones 's' surface.

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void Surface::Blit ( Surface &  s )

Makes a copy of 's' surface into target surface (self).

It's the main drawing function to build complex animations. The source surface size and position is used in order to blit the surface, meaning that the source position is relative to the target surface. The entire target surface area is available for blitting (meaning that target clip rect won't apply).

Parameters:
sSource surface. Note: target surface is self.
See also:
Rect GfxObj
void Surface::Draw (  ) [virtual]

Plot surface into owner (plane).

In order to call Draw() one must first assign the surface to a plane by calling Plane::AddToPlane(). This function will blit itself to the plane it belongs, assuming row and col positions inherited from GfxObj. These position coordinate are always relative to the plane.

See also:
GfxObj Plane

Implements GfxObj.

Reimplemented in Plane, and Screen.

void Surface::FlipH (  )

Mirror the surface horizontally.

A left image becomes a right image and vice-versa

void Surface::Scale2x (  )

Upscale the surface by 2x.

Applies Scale2x algoritmn to the surface. Each time the function is called the area is doubled.
